instruction: Create a Blueprint for a health pickup. On overlap cast to Character. If cast succeeds add 25 to a Health variable, play a sound, and destroy the actor.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthPickup
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 25.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n4: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=PickupSound]
NODE n5: GetActorLocation
NODE n6: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n4.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n4.Location [Vector]
EXEC n4.Then -> n6.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthPickup
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n4: AddFloat [B=25.0]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n6: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=PickupSound]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Float]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthPickup
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n4: AddFloat [B=25.0]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n6: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=PickupSound]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Float]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a trap. On overlap enable physics on the overlapping actor, add downward impulse of 5000, wait 2 seconds, then destroy self.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TrapFloor
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-5000)]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Trap
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-500)]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.Actor -> n5.Target [Actor] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Trap
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-500)]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.Actor -> n5.Target [Actor] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint for an interactive door. On pressing Interact check distance to player. If less than 200 use FlipFlop. A path rotates door 90 degrees and prints Open. B path rotates back and prints Closed.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_InteractiveDoor
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: FlipFlop
NODE n7: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0,Yaw=90,Roll=0)]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Open"]
NODE n9: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0,Yaw=-90,Roll=0)]
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Closed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.A -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
EXEC n6.B -> n9.Execute
EXEC n9.Then -> n10.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Door
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: GetDistanceToActor [OtherActor=Player]
NODE n3: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n4: FlipFlop
NODE n5: RotateActorOnAxis [RotationSpeed=10.0, Axis=(Yaw=1)]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Open"]
NODE n7: RotateActorOnAxis [RotationSpeed=-10.0, Axis=(Yaw=1)]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Closed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.A -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n4.B -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Door
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: GetDistanceToActor [OtherActor=Player]
NODE n3: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n4: FlipFlop
NODE n5: RotateActorOnAxis [RotationSpeed=10.0, Axis=(Yaw=1)]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Open"]
NODE n7: RotateActorOnAxis [RotationSpeed=-10.0, Axis=(Yaw=1)]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Closed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.A -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n4.B -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that spawns enemies in waves. On BeginPlay set a looping timer every 5 seconds. Each tick increment a WaveCount variable, spawn BP_Enemy at actor location, and print the wave number. After 5 waves clear the timer.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_WaveSpawner
PARENT: Actor
VAR WaveCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=SpawnWave]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
NODE n9: PrintString
NODE n10: GreaterThan [B=4]
NODE n11: Branch
NODE n12: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.SpawnTransform [Transform]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n9.InString [String]
EXEC n9.Then -> n11.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n10.A [Int]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n11.True -> n12.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_WaveSpawner
PARENT: Actor
VAR WaveCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=SpawnWave]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
NODE n9: PrintString
NODE n10: LessThan [B=5]
NODE n11: Branch
NODE n12: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.SpawnTransform [Transform]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.InString [String]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
EXEC n9.Then -> n11.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n10.A [Int]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n11.True -> n12.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_WaveSpawner
PARENT: Actor
VAR WaveCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=SpawnWave]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=WaveCount]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
NODE n9: PrintString
NODE n10: LessThan [B=5]
NODE n11: Branch
NODE n12: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnWave"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.SpawnTransform [Transform]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.InString [String]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
EXEC n9.Then -> n11.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n10.A [Int]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n11.True -> n12.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a checkpoint. On overlap cast to Character. If success, use DoOnce, save the actor location to a variable SavedLocation, play a sound, and print Checkpoint Saved.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Checkpoint
PARENT: Actor
VAR SavedLocation: Vector
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: DoOnce
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=SavedLocation]
NODE n6: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=CheckpointSound]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Checkpoint Saved"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Vector]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.Location [Vector]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Checkpoint
PARENT: Actor
VAR SavedLocation: Vector = (0,0,0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableSet [VarName=SavedLocation]
NODE n4: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=CheckpointSaved]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Checkpoint Saved"]
NODE n6: DoOnce
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n6.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
DATA n1.ActorLocation -> n3.Value [Vector]>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Checkpoint
PARENT: Actor
VAR SavedLocation: Vector = (0,0,0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableSet [VarName=SavedLocation]
NODE n4: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=CheckpointSaved]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Checkpoint Saved"]
NODE n6: DoOnce
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n6.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
DATA n1.ActorLocation -> n3.Value [Vector]>

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a damage zone. On overlap start a looping timer every 1 second. Each tick subtract 10 from Health variable and print the health. On end overlap clear the timer.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamageZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DealDamage", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DealDamage"]
NODE n5: Event_Custom [EventName=DealDamage]
NODE n6: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n7: SubtractFloat [B=10.0]
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.Value -> n9.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamageZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="TakeDamage", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="TakeDamage"]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n5: SubtractFloat [B=10.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n9: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="TakeDamage"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamageZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="TakeDamage", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="TakeDamage"]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n5: SubtractFloat [B=10.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n9: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="TakeDamage"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a collectible coin. On overlap cast to Character. If success, increment a CoinCount variable, play sound at location, print the count, and destroy self.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Coin
PARENT: Actor
VAR CoinCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n4: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n6: GetActorLocation
NODE n7: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=CoinSound]
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n5.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Location [Vector]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n8.InString [String]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CoinCollectable

VAR CoinCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n4: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n6: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=PickupSound]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n1.ActorLocation -> n6.Location [Vector]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute

EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute>

VAR CoinCount: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n4: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=CoinCount]
NODE n6: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=PickupSound]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute

DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n1.ActorLocation -> n6.Location [Vector]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute>

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a disappearing platform. On BeginPlay use a Sequence. First output makes it visible. Second output waits 3 seconds, hides it, waits 2 seconds, shows it again, looping with a timer.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BlinkPlatform
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=false]
NODE n3: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Blink", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n4: Event_Custom [EventName=Blink]
NODE n5: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=true]
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n7: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=false]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DisappearingPlatform
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n6: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n7: TimerByFunction [Time=10.0, FunctionName="ToggleVisibility"]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n10: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.StartTimer
EXEC n7.TimerExpired -> n8.Execute
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.bNewHidden [Bool]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n10.bNewHidden [Bool]>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DisappearingPlatform
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n6: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n7: TimerByFunction [Time=10.0, FunctionName="ToggleVisibility"]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]
NODE n10: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.StartTimer
EXEC n7.TimerExpired -> n8.Execute
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.bNewHidden [Bool]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n10.bNewHidden [Bool]>

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a simple enemy. On Tick get distance to player. If less than 500 print Alert and move toward player using Lerp. If more than 500 print Patrolling.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SimpleEnemy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Alert"]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Patrolling"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n5.False -> n10.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SimpleEnemy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Alert"]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Patrolling"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n9.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n9.Target [Vector]
EXEC n5.False -> n10.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SimpleEnemy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Alert"]
NODE n7: GetActorLocation
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Patrolling"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n9.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n9.Target [Vector]
EXEC n5.False -> n10.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint for a speed power-up. On overlap cast to Character. If success, set variable SpeedBoost to true, wait 5 seconds, set SpeedBoost to false, print Boost Expired, and destroy self.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpeedBoost
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpeedBoost: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableSet [VarName=SpeedBoost]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=SpeedBoost]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Boost Expired"]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute
DATA true -> n3.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
DATA false -> n5.Value [Bool]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpeedPowerUp
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpeedBoost: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableSet [VarName=SpeedBoost]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=SpeedBoost]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Boost Expired"]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute
DATA true -> n3.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
DATA false -> n5.Value [Bool]
